cellularAutomata.lattice.view
Class OneDimensionalLatticeView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  cellularAutomata.lattice.view.LatticeView
                      cellularAutomata.lattice.view.OneDimensionalLatticeView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
SliceAnalysisOneDimView
public class OneDimensionalLatticeView
extends LatticeView

Creates the display area for a one-dimensional square-grid cellular automaton.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Creates a panel of the correct height and width.

Method Detail

drawCell

public void drawCell(Cell cell,
                     int xPos,
                     int yPos)
Draws the single given cell onto an offscreen image. Draws the cell at the specified position. Note, that this does not actually draw the cell onto the component, but just onto an offscreen image.

This method is used by the LatticeMouseListener.

The body of this method may be empty if there is no offscreen graphics.

Specified by:
drawCell in class LatticeView
Parameters:
cell - The CA lattice.
xPos - The horizontal coordinate in the graphics space (in pixels) which will be converted into a lattice position where the cell will be drawn.
yPos - The vertical coordinate in the graphics space (in pixels) which will be converted into a lattice position where the cell will be drawn.

drawDefaultShapeOnGraphics

public void drawDefaultShapeOnGraphics(int row,
                                       int col,
                                       int xPos,
                                       int yPos,
                                       Cell cell,
                                       java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draw a default shape for the lattice. This should be a quickly drawn shape. The graphics method fillRect() is relatively quick and is a good choice. Note that this method is only called when the CellStateView returns null for the shape to draw -- hence this is only a backup and a default.
This method can be used intentionally for speed. (When drawing a Shape would take too long, have the CellStateView return null for getDisplayShape(), then this method will draw quickly.)

Parameters:
row - The row position on the lattice.
col - The column position on the lattice.
xPos - The x-axis pixel position of the cell.
yPos - The y-axis pixel position of the cell.
cell - The cell being drawn.
g - The graphics object onto which the default shape should be drawn.

drawSingleCell

public void drawSingleCell(int row,
                           int col,
                           int cellRow,
                           Cell cell)
Draw a single cell onto the buffered graphics (does not erase any previous drawing).

Parameters:
row - The cell's row position for display.
col - The cell's column position for display.
cellRow - The cell's state history position.
cell - The cell being drawn.

drawSingleCellWithErase

public void drawSingleCellWithErase(int row,
                                    int col,
                                    int cellRow,
                                    Cell cell)
Draw a single cell onto the buffered graphics, but first erases any previous drawing.

Parameters:
row - The cell's row position for display.
col - The cell's column position for display.
cellRow - The cell's state history position.
cell - The cell being drawn.

getCellHeight

public double getCellHeight()
The height of the bounding rectangle for each cell's graphics (when displayed on the panel).

Returns:
The height.

getCellHeightInPixels

public int getCellHeightInPixels(int row,
                                 int col)
The height of the bounding rectangle for each cell's graphics (when displayed on the panel) in integer pixels. The number of pixels per cell should never be less that 1, or it will not display.

Specified by:
getCellHeightInPixels in class LatticeView
Parameters:
row - The row position on the lattice.
col - The column position on the lattice.
Returns:
The height.

getCellUnderCursor

public Cell getCellUnderCursor(int xPos,
                               int yPos)
Return the cell displayed at the current cursor position xPos and YPos. This method is useful, for example, when we want to change the appearance or content of cells (with a mouse listener). This method is currently used to draw on the lattice.

Specified by:
getCellUnderCursor in class LatticeView
Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal coordinate of the mouse.
yPos - The vertical coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
The cell displayed at the position xPos, yPos on the graphics, or null if there is no cell in that location.

getCellWidthInPixels

                                int col)
The height of the bounding rectangle for each cell's graphics (when displayed on the panel) in integer pixels. The number of pixels per cell should never be less that 1, or it will not display.

Specified by:
getCellWidthInPixels in class LatticeView
Parameters:

getGenerationUnderCursor

public int getGenerationUnderCursor(int xPos,
                                    int yPos)
Return the generation of the cell displayed at the current cursor position xPos and yPos. Returns the current generation unless directly over a previous generation that is one of the states required as an initial condition for the next row. The number of rows used as initial conditions is given by the rule as getRequiredNumberOfGenerations().

Specified by:
getGenerationUnderCursor in class LatticeView
Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal coordinate of the mouse.
yPos - The vertical coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
The generation of the cell displayed at the position xPos, yPos on the graphics. May be -1 if there is no cell under the cursor.

getNumColumns

getRowCol

public Coordinate getRowCol(int xPos,
                            int yPos)
Given x and y coordinates on the graphics, this returns the row and column of the corresponding cell at that position.

Specified by:
getRowCol in class LatticeView
Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal position in pixels on the graphics panel.
yPos - The vertical position in pixels on the graphics panel.
Returns:
The row and column as a coordinate pair, or null if rows and columns do not make sense for the given lattice (for example, a tree).

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
Adds a picture to the panel.

This method is automatically called whenever the window is resized or otherwise altered. You can force it to be called by using the repaint method of the encompassing JFrame or JComponent. Never call this method directly (or the Graphics object may not be specified properly).

Specified by:
draw in class LatticeView

redraw

public void redraw()
Redraws the lattice from the top.

WARNING: Due to poor abstraction, the SliceAnalysisOneDimView.redraw() may need to be modified when this method is modified. Someday I'll fix that.

Specified by:
redraw in class LatticeView
